body.author: lurker
body.title: Windass volleys Hull into the promised land
body.body: Hull City will be playing Premier League football next season after Dean Windass scored the only goal of the Championship play-off final to send his hometown club into England's top division for the first time in their 104-year history at the expense of Bristol City. Windass, 39, struck a magnificent volley late in the first half to give Phil Brown's side a narrow win and a promotion which will be worth millions of pounds.In a tight game typical of this Championship season Windass was able to produce the one outstanding moment of quality with his 39th-minute strike and earn himself another trip to face the likes of Manchester United and Chelsea next season.
